festival.introText:
Lost Village is an immersive festival experience, in an abandoned woodland village. 

As you venture into the woods, you enter a land that time forgot; an ancient forest inhabited by all manner of unusual people. Nomadic tribes, clandestine cults and misplaced souls, all wonder its leafy corridors. Once inside you will co-exist with the native people of the Village, as reality flickers and a new world arises. A surreal dreamscape of unsolved mysteries.

Whether dancing in the grounds of the Abandoned Chapel, feasting at the Tribal Banquet, learning new skills on Forger’s Lane or expanding your mind in the Institute of Curious Minds; this is truly a festival experience like no other. 

The Lake of Tranquility lures you to the waters edge, with promises of hot tubs, saunas and relaxation, whilst the Lost Theatre plays host to a spectacular line-up of the country’s finest comedy. A passion for food flows throughout the woods, with a myriad of global street food restaurants lining the Basecamp and Tribal Banquets serving Michelin star level food, cooked by some of the UK’s most forward-thinking young chefs. Much more than a music festival, Lost Village is a land of discovery.

Early booking is strongly advised, due to the intimate size of the festival. 

The woods are waiting…
festival.descriptionText: Get more information about Lost Village including festival tickets, news, reviews and lineups.

reviews.title: Review of Lost Village Festival 2018
reviews.body: Music finished waaaay too early and not enough to do after 2pm, sound levels were also too low.

reviews.title: Review of Lost Village Festival
reviews.body: The music was great, as you'd expect with the line up they had booked. Venue was very creative and loved it being in the forest. Prices were slightly cheaper than standard festival prices at £4 Pint of Coors Light, £6 Double Vodka Coke, about £7.50 for a cheeseburger (was very nice..). It was a very freindly atmosphere, didn't see any trouble whatsoever which was great, hoping the festival doesn't expand too much as it was perfect sized, intimate, friendly vibed festival.

reviews.title: Review of Lost Village Festival
reviews.body: Amazing festival, practically faultless apart from the food prices.

reviews.title: Review of Lost Village Festival
reviews.body: Absolutely perfect weekend, amazing atmosphere, great crowd! Speakers could have been a little louder!

reviews.title: Review of Lost Village Festival
reviews.body: The best Festival I have ever been to, every little detail from the weird decorations to the freaky actors all added to the amazing atmosphere.

reviews.title: Review of Lost Village Festival
reviews.body: Security off there head and not friendly

faqs.question: How much are tickets for Lost Village?
faqs.answer: Lost Village tickets are released in phases, with each phase increasing slightly in price.

faqs.question: How to get to Lost village festival by train.
faqs.answer:
The nearest train station is Newark North Gate (approximately 10 minutes by car) and Lincoln  Central (approximately 15 minutes).

There will be frequent shuttle buses between Newark Northgate and the festival site.

There are direct trains to Newark North Gate from many major cities, including the following:

London 80 mins

Leeds 60 mins

Peterborough 33 mins

Nottingham 40 mins

York 45 mins

Newcastle  110 mins

Manchester 120 mins

Edinburgh 200 mins

 

For more information visit National Rail. There will be frequent shuttle buses running from Newark Northgate to the Lost Village site.

faqs.question: Is there Disabled access at Lost Village
faqs.answer: If you are disabled or care for someone who is, please drop them an email - hello@lostvillagefestival.com and they will be very happy to assist you in every way that they can.

faqs.question: Are pre-payment plan tickets available for Lost Village?
faqs.answer: No, there aren't any payment plans available for this event.

faqs.question: How to get to Lost Village by car/ coach.
faqs.answer:
Car

Our site is 10 minutes from Lincoln City centre. There will be official Lost Village parking at the cost of £20 per vehicle. Please sign-up to our Newsletter via the homepage for more information on how purchase a parking ticket (details released February).

To use our official parking you must purchase a parking ticket prior to the festival.

Coach

Coaches will be running to the event from several key locations around the counter, operated by Big Green Coach.

You can book your coach journey now by heading to their website HERE

For every customer who books travel with Big Green Coach they sponsor and protect 5 square foot of Amazonian Rainforest for 10 years!

faqs.question: When is Lost Village?
faqs.answer: Lost Village takes place Thursday 24th August - Sunday 27th August 2023.

faqs.question: Names on Ticket Policy/Name Changes for Lost Village
faqs.answer: All Lost Village tickets will have the ticket holder’s name on them. Ticket holders MUST bring a valid photo form of ID to gain entry, along with their personalised ticket. The name on the ID has to match the name on the ticket.

faqs.question: Where is Lost Village?
faqs.answer:
Lost Village is located in Lincolnshire.

Address:

Secret Location,

Lincolnshire,

LN6 9HN

 

 The site is just off the A46, there will be lots of signs to guide you.

faqs.question: What happens If I bought a ticket to Lost Village and cannot attend?
faqs.answer:
Unfortunately we can’t issue you with a refund if you can’t make the event due to work commitments or your mates have dropped out. In these circumstances, we advise passing on your tickets privately to avoid losing out on the money spent.

Refunds can only be offered if the event is cancelled or postponed, as agreed upon purchase.
